intro: Jamesbrittenia albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin riverbloom, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking white petals with a distinct yellow margin, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in shallow waters, thriving in muddy or sandy substrates. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often floating on the water surface. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
